Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller58
Reviews.Content: If it worries you that the rooms are small, the 'double' bed was two singles pushed together, the bed headboard was very rattly (the last two items not condusive to a passionate night!), and the lift (elevator) was very small, then don't book this hotel. However it has an excellent location, we walked everywhere apart from the Vatican, which was 9 euros from the taxi rank virtually opposite the hotel, the hotel was very clean with very helpfull friendly staff. Breakfast had a limited choice, but had excellent coffee, fruit juice and pastries. The only minus point that bothered me was that the shower was quite cramped, but all in all I'd recommend this hotel, we stayed 3 nights and I'm glad we booked the San Silvestro. There was a little noise from the road outside the hotel, but what do you expect if you stay in the centre of Rome? There were many bars/restaurants close to the hotel at a reasonable price, I'd recommend the nearby Pizza Ciro in Via della Mercede, don't be fooled by the name, it's a lot more than a pizza restaurant, and frequented by locals which says a lot. The hotel is also ideally situated for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Erica D
Reviews.Content: Small but good hotel. Rooms were very small, but everything was ok. Breakfast room also very small, but breakfast itself was very good, great variety of choices. Staff was very helpfull & friendly. Very nice hotel & good location in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: angela97
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is basic.Firstly I stay in a double room which was ok, but the last day they transfered me to a single room, which was just a corridor, very small bed and tiny bathroom.It is good that hotel location is perfect - 5 minutes away from Fontan di Trevi - so you dont have to stay in the room. The lady who prepares coffees and capuccino during breakfast is very friendly and the cappuccino is great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great little city hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivien c
Reviews.Content: The San Silvestro was perfect for my 5 day solo adventure in Roma. The location is also perfect - right in the heart of historical Rome, shops, cafes and restaurants close by. My room was small but lovely and clean and breakfast was available in my room if I wished. The staff were kind and helpful. I could not have wished for a better place - it was a safe haven each night after exploring the delights of this fab city. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: cjfry
Reviews.Content: After an awful experience at another hotel we relocated during our trip. We walked in and they got us right into a room and were VERY friendly. There English is actually very good and they were so nice about everything, they even made reservations for us at popular restaurants and made sure we had english speaking waiters. The rooms are small, but its a killer location and kind of what you would expect for the price. But I highly recommend this to anyone. It is not a 4 or 5 star hotel by american standards, but it was comfortable and we were very happy there for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: carondarwood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic,as the other reviews say, the rooms are small but are perfectly adequate for a weekend away. I went with a friend and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is very clean and the breakfast is as one would expect for a tourist hotel. They do make an excellent cappucino - and offer room service if required. The location is perfect, so close to everything., It isn't a hotel, necessarily that you would go to for a romantic weekend away, but, we had a great time and would definitely recommend to others and stay there again. The only thing that I would think could add to the hotel would be some sort of bar area - and free wifi! (it;s available for a charge)

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much and you won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Ceendy28
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location. You are exactly in the middle and walking distance of all the attractions in Rome. There is a large bus depot right outside the hotel for easy commuting...but, the hotel itself is ugly. It's dated and old. Perhaps it seemed this terrible to us because we had just come off of staying in the most wonderful hotels in Tuscany and Sorrento for the same about of money or less. After the shock of this hotel wore off, we realized that we should make the best of it and we weren't gonna be in the room that much anyway. The ease of walking to the Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps made up for the other short comings of this hotel. The breakfast was also disappointing (mainly because of our experiences with the other hotels). The breakfast consists of coffee, tea, bread, triangle cheese spreads, butter and jam. Nothing fresh or exciting. We searched the neighborhood for a better hotel for the same money but didn't find anything or we would have moved very quickly! Also, be prepared that in Rome, there is no such thing as free internet. To sum this up, don't expect much and you won't be disappointed. I would recommend this hotel only because of it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: moorsiders21
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the lastminute .com website. The list of room facilities included tea and coffe making facilitieswhich was something we wanted, however this turned out not to be true and we were told if we came down to reception they would get us a tea or coffe. not quite the same thing. When we complained to the manager he said if we were not happy we could leave! the room was small but adequate but the room for the breakfast buffet was tiny and had room for onle 12 people at a time. Yes there was a lift but it only went to the 2nd floor and we were on the 3rd floor, the lounge consisted of a room between each floor with a few chairs and all the rooms leading off it.Yes it was handy for the Trevi fountain but if you were going to use the hop on off bus the nearest stops were quite a walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, unfriendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FarmerM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. But found the staff tied and unfriendly. I am sure they get sick of a stream of tourists but no excuse. The rooms are small, the bathroom adequate, but beds not comfortable and insufficient blankets for time of year. The hotel is so so noisy, my room was over looking a side street, and I found it noisy - Rome never sleeps. My friends room was on a light well, and was all so noisy from the stair well, and the laundry deliveries at 4am and cleaners starting shortly after.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: I had to move to this hotel for 2 nights, as I had extended my trip and my previous hotel was fully booked. I would highly recommend, lovely clean place, good breakfast and excellent location just off Via del Corso, 10 minute walk to Pantheon, Trevi and Spanish Steps. I also liked that as I checked in early, my room was not ready, so I went out, when I returned they had taken my luggage up to my room, a very nice gesture. My single room was small, but no problem, near the back so very quiet. The bathroom had all modern amenities, breakfast was great with lovely pastries and good capucinno, Staff were also very kind, the morning i left the guy on reception waited with me for the taxi, to make sure the right taxi picked me up, so that I would not be "intercepted" by a different firm, which I thought was very kind. Would definitely stay here again on my many visits to Rome, perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly, perfect location hotel”
Reviews.Author: danskpige
Reviews.Content: Small room - yes... But staff was friendly and helpfull, clean and nice room, good location and good breakfast. Take the cheap 5.50 Euro train from the airport and get off at Tuscolana. Continue with bus 85 to San Silvestro or Metro to Spanish steps. Another idea. The lines to get in to the famous places, can look very long, dont believe the people selling guided tours about hours of waiting, it only took 15 minutes... save your money for the fantastic food. Last great idea. Eat at "Life", a winebar/restaurant 2 blocks from the hotel at Via della Vite 28. Very good food and perfect service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster24
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel! Yes, the rooms are small, but who goes to Rome to spend lots of time in their hotel rooms?!?! There was a man at the front desk, Marko, who was, by far, the nicest person at a hotel I've ever met. I had to leave early to catch a bus to Sorrento, and he offered to help me gather food for breakfast, even though the cafe wasn't open yet. He also helped me immensely trying to figure out the confusing bus schedule. I have never encountered someone as friendly as he was. The hotel is so central that you absolutely must stay here when you visit Rome. It's just off San Silvestro square. From here, you can easily get a bus to Termini or Tiburtina stations, and from there, your options are countless. You're just minutes, by foot, from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. If you don't have much luggage, you can easily catch a bus to San Silvestro square from Termini or Tiburtina (it's the last stop on the 71 bus). You'll save yourself lots of money vs. taking a taxi! The hotel is literally steps from the bus stop. I'd recommend arriving during the day so you can get your bearings straight. I would absolutely stay here again thanks to Marko's service!

Reviews.Title: “Had some issues....”
Reviews.Author: Phylgina
Reviews.Content: We got into Rome with no hotel reservation and this hotel was recommended by a shuttle bus driver in the airport. When we got there we were exhausted, but had we been a little more alert, we would not have stayed there. The room was so small, we could barely move with 2 people in the room. The bathroom was the size of a kleenex box and not very clean. At night it was very noisy and we were woken up several times by car alarms, people screaming in the street and traffic. The breakfast was ok, but once again, the room was so small, we had to wait for a table to clear, on several mornings. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the location. It was midway between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain and very close to a Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: coloren
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because recomended by friends. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was near everything so we didn't even have to take a bus or a metro to go anywhere. The breakfast was good, the rooms are just a little tiny but we were out all day so what we were interested in was a good sleep with air conditioning. The breakfast lady was the nicest breakfast lady ever met in any hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be shocked!”
Reviews.Author: pronovias
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this so called 3 star hotel on the 13 september 2006.The room was tiny as was the ensuite. The bed linen was old and had cigarette burns on them.There was only one small towel per person and the breakfast menu was very limited.In Ireland this hotel would be considered a very low market bed and breakfast.I would not recommend this "hotel" to anyone i know.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have travelled around the world for years but I never, ever seen anything like this. When we got to our room we burst out laughting as it was disgusting. Everything was dirty, old and worn. We did sleep with a terrible sewer stink. We can't comment on breakfast as we went elsewhere to look for somewhere clean. Do not stay here. If you stay, stay at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenjen81
Reviews.Content: The room was absolutely appalling, it was unbelievable, I didn't believe the previous review of how bad it was, but next time I will pay more attention to bad reviews. I also left and was charged for the whole stay. Stay Away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in the world? Beware”
Reviews.Author: myScreenNameUK
Reviews.Content: It is a shame that 1 star is the lowest you can give a hotel as this hotel is shamed by those with 1 star. I can't express in words how terrible my 5 minute (paid for much more) stay was at this hotel. Climbing the stairs to my room, I started to get worried about the amount of dirt about, but nothing prepared me for what I was about to see. Upon opening the door to my room I came across a wall, in fact this wall was the extent of the room. Entering I noted I could touch three walls at the same time and could almost touch the forth. But the size was not the problem, the room was dirty, a layer of dust on the small cabinet where the phone rested. The Wardrobe/box was falling apart and there was grime and horrible insects crawling on the bed. All this for €120. I asked for another room but none were available, so I had no choice other than to leave. They let me leave and gave me my things back, but still charged my card the money for my stay. I found this downright scandalous considering I didn't get what was shown on their website. BEWARE I stayed in better places when I backpacked round Asia for 5p a night. I wish I had my camera with me

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Silvestro
HotelInfo.Address: Via Del Gambero 3, 00187 Rome, Italy
